markdownRemark.html:
Imagine the following situation in Unreal Engine 4 gameplay code:

APlayer::OnAttacked()
{
    USoundSystem* SoundSystem = GameInstance->GetSoundSystem();
    if (IsValid(SoundSystem))
    {
        SoundSystem->PlaySoundCue(OnAttackedSoundCue);
    }
}

SoundSystem can be invalid but what does that mean? Is is OK situation to just use IsValid() and do nothing.

It seems this issue is more complex that it looks like/.

Happy reading!

frontmatter.title: Handling invalid C++ pointers
frontmatter.description: In this article I will briefly explain approaches to check if a pointer is valid and why it is important.
